citation.article-title: Culturable phylogenetic diversity of the phylum 'Bacteroidetes' from river epilithon and coastal water and description of novel members of the family Flavobacteriaceae: Epilithonimonas tenax gen. nov., sp. nov. and Persicivirga xylanidelens gen. nov., sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Persicivirga (Per.si.ci.vir′ga. L. neut. n. persicum peach; L. fem. n. virga rod; N.L. fem. n. Persicivirga peach-coloured rod).
Long, irregularly straight to curved, Gram-negative rods with no visible flagella.
Do not utilize carbohydrates for growth.
The most abundant fatty acids are saturated branched-chain, unsaturated branched-chain and hydroxy fatty acids; iso 15 : 0 and anteiso 15 : 0 are the most abundant individual fatty acids.
Isolated from marine environments and require Na+ ions or natural sea water for growth.
16S rRNA gene sequence analysis indicates that the genus Persicivirga is a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae of the phylum ‘Bacteroidetes’.
The type species is Persicivirga xylanidelens.
